III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member verbally abused a youth and told him to go and kill
himself.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/14/2025 a telephone call was made to Complainant. It
was advised that there were many concerns regarding Methodist
and youth that are placed at the facility. The complainant did not
have specific concerns, however stated they do not like how youth
have to be placed at the residential facility and does not feel like
the agency takes good care of the youth. Although consultant
inquired, no detailed or specific examples were provided.
Complainant stated that she was told these allegations by Youth
B. She did not have additional concerns to report other than those
initially expressed.
On 04/14/2025 an email was sent to Foster Care Worker 1
(FCW1) and Foster Care Worker 2 (FCW2) advising of
allegations and requesting a response with any concerns or
questions.
On 04/17/2025 a meeting was held with Youth A at Methodist.
The DHHS Specialist was also present. He reported he has been
at the agency for about four months. Youth A reports that staff
yell and curse all the time. He stated it’s like “hell here”. Youth A
reports that it has been worse since Staff 1 has been gone. When
asked for examples, he first responded that he didn’t know, but
then said he couldn’t say because he would get in trouble. He
would not provide names of staff that he has heard yell or curse.
He stated staff will say “get your lazy ass up and do your chores”.
He provided his example but was unwilling or unable to indicate
which staff he has heard say it. Youth A denied that he has ever
reported his concerns about staff yelling or cursing to anyone. He
stated he did not report it because he did not want to get in
2

trouble. Youth A denied that any staff told him to go and “kill
himself”.
On 04/17/2025 an interview was completed with Senior Director
of Residential (SDR). He advised that he has been employed
with the agency for four years. He denied having knowledge of
any incidents involving Staff 1, Youth A and Youth B. He denied
having knowledge of or hearing that a staff told a youth to go and
“kill himself”. He advised that Staff 1 is contingent, meaning she
picks up shifts with the agency as needed, and does not work
every day at the agency. SDR also confirmed that there were no
incident reports as no incidents had been reported to the agency
for documentation. A request was made for youth face sheets
and agency policy. SDR was also advised of statements by Youth
A regarding thoughts of self-harm. He confirmed that the agency
was aware of the ideations of Youth A and he has been engaged
with his therapist and clinical team and met with his therapist
today. SDR also advised that the agency uses the Columbia
Suicide Risk Assessment and treat results as “true intent”. DHHS
Specialist discussed and confirmed the safety plan with SDR.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Therapist.
She confirmed that she is the therapist for both Youth A and Youth
B. Therapist denied having knowledge of or hearing that a staff
told a youth to go and “kill” themselves.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Methodist. She specifically denied hearing anything about a staff
telling Youth B or any other youth to go and kill himself. Staff 2
expressed some other concerns regarding the actions of Staff 1
involving a different youth. Those allegations are being
investigated as a part of SI# 2025SIC0000604.
On 04/24/2025 interviews were completed with Youth C and
Youth D. Both youth deny any knowledge of Staff 1 being
verbally inappropriate with youth at the agency or having
knowledge of any staff telling youth to “kill” themselves. Both
youth spoke positively regarding Staff 1 and one referenced her
as “amazing”.
On 05/01/2025 an in-person interview was completed with
Supervisor 1. She denied having knowledge of or hearing of
Staff 1 telling Youth B or any other youth to go and kill himself.
She denied telling any youth to go and kill themselves. Supervisor
1 reported that she has assessed Staff 1 to have appropriate
interactions with the youth when working.
3

On 05/01/2025 in-person interviews were completed with
Supervisor 2 and Staff 3 at Methodist. They both denied hearing
of a staff telling a youth to go and kill himself or engaging in this
behavior themselves. Lastly, they denied that either of these
allegations were reported to them by Youth A or Youth B.
On 05/08/2025 and 05/19/2025 attempts were made to contact
Staff 1 via telephone without success. On 6/02/2025 a telephone
interview was completed with Staff 1. She advised that she is a
contingent employee and works mostly second shift. She denied
telling Youth B to “kill himself” and denied hearing staff speak
poorly to any youth at the agency.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Reports: There were no incident reports as neither
incident was reported to staff and no staff reported witnessing the
event occur.
Methodist Agency Policy: Discipline and Consequences Policy -
Employees will only adhere to the behavior management
techniques as taught by MCHS. MCHS does not sanction any
form of corporal punishment and or inappropriate hands-on
intervention such as but not limited to pinching, spanking,
slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling hair, grabbing
pushing and threatening gestures.
Video Footage: No video footage was available of the incident
DHHS Specialist Social Work Contacts:
5/8/2025 SWC documented a conversation with the parents of
Youth A. They indicated that they currently participate in both on-
campus and off-campus visits with Youth A. They report that he
has never reported any concerns with staff at the agency and also
denied having any concerns regarding his safety.
5/23/2025 SWC documented an interview with Youth E and Youth
F and both deny any concerns with Staff 1 and deny seeing or
hearing of her being physically or verbally inappropriate with
agency youth.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. There was not sufficient
evidence to support that this statement was made to Youth A. In
addition, interviews with Youth were inconsistent and he was not
4

willing to provide specific information or additional details that
would allow for more in-depth investigation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/11/25, a staff member grabbed a youth's face behind the ear
and pushed the youth to the corner and put their hands on the
youth's chest. The staff member slapped the youth's face twice
and caused the youth's head to hit the wall. The youth tried to
walk away but was further assaulted.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/17/2025 a meeting was held with Youth A at Methodist.
The DHHS Specialist was also present. He reported he has been
at the agency for about four months. Youth A denies seeing Staff
1 put her hands on any youth. He stated he can’t say if any other
staff put their hands-on youth because he will get in trouble.
Youth A was asked to identify staff on the campus that he feels
comfortable with, and he indicated Residential Coordinator. Youth
A advised that he had been having thoughts of harming himself
and told the staff. He reported they removed items from his room
and he has been seeing Therapist but feels like she does not
care. Youth A was not able to provide specific reasons why he felt
the therapist “did not care”. He stated he last saw the therapist
yesterday.
On 04/17/2025 Youth B was interviewed at Methodist and DHHS
Specialist was present. Youth B initially refused to meet with
DCWL and DHHS. He finally agreed to participate if a timer was
set for 3.5 minutes. He reported that he gets along with Staff 1
about “5%”. He reported Staff 1 swiped her finger across his face
and his head hit the wall. He demonstrated by holding his index
finger out and then tapping his cheek. Youth B denied having
any injuries or pain from the incident and reported no other youth
5

witnessed it. Youth B indicated it happen around bedtime during
the medication pass. He reported it occurred in his room but
would not be on camera because there are no cameras in the
bedrooms. He reported that he believes she did it because he
was annoying her, and shared that he feels that Staff 1 deserves
to be annoyed. He denied ever being hit by other staff and denied
he has ever had to scream for help. He denied seeing Staff 1 do
anything to other youth in the program. No other staff has ever
put hands on him. He denied ever screaming for help. He then
ended the interview because his allotted time was up.
On 04/17/2025 an interview was completed with Senior Director
of Residential (SDR). He advised that he has been employed
with the agency for four years. He denied having knowledge of
any incidents involving Staff 1, Youth A and Youth B. He advised
that Staff 1 is contingent and does not work every day at the
agency. SDR also confirmed that there were no incident reports
as no incidents had been reported to the agency for
documentation.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Therapist.
She confirmed that she is the therapist for both Youth A and Youth
B. She reports seeing them weekly and denies that either youth
has reported any concerns to her and further denied any concerns
of her own regarding any abuse or neglect of Youth A or Youth B.
Therapist did recall having a discussion with Youth B and Staff 1.
She denied that Youth B ever stated that Staff 1 had hit him.
Youth B did report to her that he wanted Staff 1 to be “nicer” to
him and when asked for a specific example he stated he wanted
her to ask him how his day was when he gets out of school.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Methodist. She denied knowledge of Staff 1 hitting or slapping
Youth A or being verbally aggressive toward Youth B. Staff 2
expressed some other concerns regarding the actions of Staff 1
involving a different youth. Those allegations are being
investigated as a part of SI# 2025SIC0000604.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
D. He denied any knowledge of Staff 1 being inappropriate with
youth at the agency. He spoke positively regarding Staff 1 and his
interactions with her.
On 05/01/2025 an in-person interview was completed with
Supervisor 1. She denied knowledge of Staff 1 hitting, slapping
or being physically inappropriate with Youth A, Youth B or any
6

other youth at the agency. She denied that she uses physical
discipline with agency youth. Supervisor 1 reported that she has
assessed Staff 1 to have appropriate interactions with the youth
when working.
On 05/01/2025 in-person interviews were completed with
Supervisor 2 and Staff 3 at Methodist. Both staff deny having
any knowledge of Staff 1 engaging in inappropriate behavior or
using inappropriate language with youth at the agency. Lastly,
they denied that either of these allegations were reported to them
by Youth A or Youth B.
On 05/01/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
C. He denied any knowledge of Staff 1 being inappropriate with
youth at the agency. He spoke positively regarding Staff 1 and
referenced her as “amazing”.
On 05/08/2025 and 05/19/2025 attempts were made to contact
Staff 1 via telephone without success. On 6/02/2025 a telephone
interview was completed with Staff 1. She advised that she is a
contingent employee and works mostly second shift. She reports
that she gets along well with the youth and have a couple of them
that refer to her as their favorite staff. She denied hitting,
slapping, pushing or doing anything to Youth A or Youth B that
would cause them to hit their head. Staff 1 stated there has never
been a time where she has placed her hands on a youth, not even
in a joking manner.
On 05/12/2025 a DHHS Closing Case conference was held.
DHHS and DCWL provide an update regarding the investigation
and advised that final findings will be provided once reports are
completed. On 5/23/2025 it was confirmed that there were no
DHHS findings relative to abuse and/or neglect.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Reports: There were no incident reports as neither
incident was reported to staff and no staff reported witnessing the
event occur.
Methodist Agency Policy: Discipline and Consequences Policy -
Employees will only adhere to the behavior management
techniques as taught by MCHS. MCHS does not sanction any
form of corporal punishment and or inappropriate hands-on
intervention such as but not limited to pinching, spanking,
slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling hair, grabbing
pushing and threatening gestures.
7

Video Footage: No video footage was available for the incident
DHHS Specialist Social Work Contacts:
5/8/2025 SWC documented a conversation with the parents of
Youth A. They indicated that they currently participate in both on-
campus and off-campus visits with Youth A. They report that he
has never reported any concerns with staff at the agency and also
denied having any concerns regarding his safety.
5/23/2025 SWC documented an interview with Youth E and Youth
F and both deny any concerns with Staff 1 and deny seeing or
hearing of her being physically or verbally inappropriate with
agency youth.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. There was not sufficient
evidence to support that Staff 1 had been physically and verbally
inappropriate with Youth A, Youth B or any youth at the agency.
There was no video footage for review and most staff and youth
that were interviewed denied knowledge of or hearing of Staff 1
behaving inappropriately with youth at the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
